name: apt18

procedures: T1027::[APT18] obfuscates strings in the payload.
T1053.002::[APT18] actors used the native [at] Windows task scheduler tool to use scheduled tasks for execution on a victim network.
T1059.003::[APT18] uses cmd.exe to execute commands on the victim’s machine.
T1070.004::[APT18] actors deleted tools and batch files from victim systems.
T1071.001::[APT18] uses HTTP for C2 communications.
T1071.004::[APT18] uses DNS for C2 communications.
T1078::[APT18] actors leverage legitimate credentials to log into external remote services.
T1082::[APT18] can collect system information from the victim’s machine.
T1083::[APT18] can list files information for specific directories.
T1105::[APT18] can upload a file to the victim’s machine.
T1133::[APT18] actors leverage legitimate credentials to log into external remote services.
T1547.001::[APT18] establishes persistence via the HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run key.

description: [APT18](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0026) is a threat group that has operated since at least 2009 and has targeted a range of industries, including technology, manufacturing, human rights groups, government, and medical. (Citation: Dell Lateral Movement)
